alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Oldham and western Deaf Smith Counties through 345 PM CST... At 259 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of Glenrio to 11 miles north of Bellview to 9 miles southwest of Rhea. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Adrian, Glenrio, Bootleg, and Simms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
